DOCNAME: CASE OF KOSHELEVA AND OTHERS v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 34 - Individual applications (Article 34 - Hinder the exercise of the right of petition);Non-pecuniary damage - award;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;Erik Møse;Khanlar Hajiyev;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ names and dates of birth are listed in the annex to the present judgment . They live in PERSON , GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants are former and current teachers at the boarding school for orphans and children deprived of parental care in PERSON , GPE ( « GPE средняя школа-интернат для детей-сирот и детей , оставшихся без попечения родителей PERSON ) . By virtue of a provision in the national law they were entitled to a DATE allowance for purchase of books and magazines ( компенсация за книгоиздательскую продукцию и периодические издания ) which had not been paid to them for DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicants applied to a court seeking recovery of the unpaid allowance .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Justice of Peace of Court Circuit no . CARDINAL of PERSON in LOC granted the applicants’ claim for the unpaid allowance and held that ORG of ORG should reimburse them various amounts .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE upheld that judgment on appeal .

CARDINAL . Following an unspecified period during which the judgment remained unenforced , the applicants allegedly applied to a court for indexlinking of the awards due to the inflation but had their claims rejected . They did not however submit any documents to support this claim , nor did they indicate the date of the judicial decision or the court adopting it .
CARDINAL . The Government submitted copies of payroll records according to which the awards had been paid to the applicants in DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG received letters from thirtysix applicants stating that they no longer had interest in pursuing the application due to the timely enforcement of the judgment in their favour . The applicants who sent the letters were ORG . CARDINAL . NORP In their observations received by the Court on DATE the remaining CARDINAL applicants submitted that the town prosecutor ’s office had summoned them for interviews , during which the authorities had apprised them of their right not to incriminate themselves and discussed their application .

CARDINAL . The letter by the deputy prosecutor of PERSON of DATE confirmed that in DATE the town prosecutor ’s office had held interviews with the applicants concerning alleged breaches of their ‘ Convention right to timely payment of the allowance for purchase of books and ORG . The letter mentioned that the interviews had been conducted following an inquiry by the ORG ’s representative at ORG to ORG .
